not.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: used to make a word, statement, or question negative
not.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: Most of the stores do not open until 10 am.
She’s not a very nice person.
You were wrong not to inform the police.
‘Can we go to the park?’ ‘No, not today, dear.’
The changes were not at all surprising.
I do not like his attitude at all.
not.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: used in order to make a word or expression have the opposite meaning
not.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: The food is not very good there.
Most of the hotels are not that cheap  (=they are fairly expensive).
Not much is known about the disease.
Not many people have read the report.
not.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: used instead of a whole phrase to mean the opposite of what has been mentioned before it
not.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: No one knows if the story is true or not.
I hope to see you tomorrow, but if not, leave me a message.
not.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: GRAMMAR: Negatives
Don’t use another negative word such as ‘no’, ‘nothing’, or ‘nobody’ after not Use any, anything, anybody etc You say
They do not have any money
They do not have no money
Not goes before ‘to’ in an infinitive verb You say
I try not to make mistakes
I try to not make mistakes
